reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon!
reviews.text: Peter Island far exceeded our expectations! Everything was perfect. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The food was great, the room was nice, and the island was INCREDIBLE! We took a day trip to Virgin Gorda which was fun, but we could not wait to get back to PI!

reviews.title: Heaven on Earth
reviews.text: Deadman's Bay was gorgeous. We felt like we had the beach to ourselves and actually when we went there at night we usually did!

reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful!
reviews.text: There is not much in the way of nightlife, but we were there on our honeymoon so that is what we wanted.

reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations/Anticipate Return
reviews.text: There are some poor reviews here on this site. Perhaps there were problems in the past. If there were, they have been fixed or never really existed. Everything was top notch when we went.
My husband and I celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary on Peter Island (Oct. 2004). Our stay was wonderful, relaxing and soothing to the soul.
reviews.title: Loved Peter Island
Disappointed that the new spa is not open
reviews.text: ISLAND/RESORT: Hilly, lush, beautiful landscaping all around the resort (lots of different flower varieties). There's a luxury feeling to the resort without the stuffiness. At night, the resort is beautifully lit. There's just enough light to see where you're going and give you that romantic feel of the night.

reviews.title: ABSOLUTE PARADISE
reviews.text: RESTAURANTS: There are 2. During our stay, Tradewinds (near the pool/lobby area) offered breakfast daily and dinner on certain nights. Dinner at Tradewinds is a dressier affair (meaning no shorts, no flip-flops, etc...). Deadman's Beach Bar & Grill offered lunch daily and dinner on the nights Tradewinds was closed. Dinner at the Beach & Bar Grill is a more casual affair (meaning you can wear shorts, flip-flops, etc...).

reviews.title: Best of the Best Resort-boaters must go!!!!!
